title: There Is No Stopping Sumit Nagal As He Storms Into Semis Of ATP Challenger Campinas
text:
There Is No Stopping Sumit Nagal As He Storms Into Semis Of ATP Challenger Campinas

There Is No Stopping Sumit Nagal As He Storms Into Semis Of ATP Challenger Campinas

Indian Sumit Nagal continued his fine season after sailing into the the semifinals of the ATP Challenger Campinas with a hard-fought win over Argentina’s Francisco Cerundolo.

AP

Nagal, who is making the right kind of noise on the tracks was recently placed at a career-best 135 in the ATP rankings, knocked out 13th seed Cerundolo 7-6 7-5 to book his second last-four appearance in two weeks.

Coming into the game with growing confidence and reputation, Nagal had to fight hard in the first as it went into a tie-break with the Indian prevailing 7-6. The second set too went down to the wire, but Nagal proved too good as he took the set 7-5.

AFP

Don't Miss 10.5 K SHARES 1.3 K SHARES 1.5 K SHARES 247 SHARES 449 SHARES

A 7-6, 7-5 win, means Sumit Nagal will enter another last four clash. He continues to make rapid strides and is on the right track.

Nagal had received a bye in the first round and then in the second round, his opponent Gastao Elias of Portugal retired midway in the first set. In the round of 16, the Indian beat Brazilian Orlando Luz 7-5 6-3.

The sixth seed Indian will now face Juan Pablo Ficovich of Argentina in the final.

Earlier this week, Nagal won his second title on the ATP Challenger Tour. He notched up a straight-set win over Argentina’s Facundo Bognis to claim the Buenos Aires ATP Challenger clay-court event.

(With Inputs From PTI)
